measured_by: Intolerance of Uncertainty Scale – German 18-item version (Freeston et al., 1994; Gerlach et al., 2008)
justification: “At baseline, participants completed the Intolerance of Uncertainty Scale … German version by Gerlach et al., 2008.”

measured_by: Three adapted state items from the Intolerance of Uncertainty Scale
justification: “State IU was assessed … Three items were adapted from the Intolerance of Uncertainty Scale … ‘Uncertainty makes/made me uneasy…’ etc.”
“Trait indecisiveness was measured using the 15 item Indecisiveness Scale (Frost & Shows, 1993).”

measured_by: Three adapted items from the Indecisiveness Scale
justification: “State indecisiveness was assessed using three items adapted from the Indecisiveness Scale.”

measured_by: 8-item Safety Behavior measure assessing problematic uncertainty-reducing behavior
justification: “Participants rated the described behavior on eight items representing criteria of problematic safety behavior … Higher scores thus reflected that the reported uncertainty-reducing behavior fulfilled more criteria of problematic … safety behavior.”

measured_by: Two high-loading items from the Decision Features taxonomy
justification: “Based on factor analysis … five dimensions were identified, for example, Decision Importance … For the current study, the two items with the highest loadings on each factor were included, resulting in ten items.”
